title: APA Corporation: Deep-Value Energy Stock
summary: APA Corporation (APA) is spotlighted as a deeply undervalued energy stock, trading at a 20% discount to its intrinsic value with an Acquirer's Multiple of 4.8. The company, a global oil and gas producer, consistently generates robust free cash flow and maintains strong operating margins due to disciplined cost management and a diversified asset base. Despite perceived market skepticism regarding long-term commodity prices, APA presents a compelling opportunity for value investors seeking a cash-generative operator.

title: 5G take-up lags in Europe
summary: Six years after the first commercial launches, 5G adoption in Europe remains low in many markets, with less than 40% of mobile subscribers using 5G in 11 of 14 markets with available data. This slow take-up contrasts with the rapid adoption of 4G services and is attributed to regulatory delays, low investment, uneven economic conditions, and stagnation in smartphone shipments. Spectrum limitations and the initial reliance on non-standalone 5G have also hindered widespread expansion and advanced feature monetization.

title: PayPal Slips After Morgan Stanley Downgrade on Growth, Execution Concerns
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded PayPal (PYPL) to Underweight due to structural and operational difficulties, citing concerns over Branded Checkout's market share loss to Apple Pay and Stripe, and Venmo's failure to monetize. Analyst James Faucette also highlighted PayPal's poor technical integrations as a hinderance to participating in new platforms like ChatGPT and predicted slower growth and increased marketing costs would impact profitability. Following the downgrade, PayPal shares experienced a premarket drop of 1.7%.

title: Globalstar (GSAT) Stock News Today (Dec. 18, 2025): Insider Sale Sparks Pullback as Band n53 and XCOM RAN Momentum Builds
summary: Globalstar (GSAT) experienced a sharp pullback after a strong multi-month run, driven by headlines concerning an insider stock sale by CFO Rebecca Clary. While the market reacted negatively, the company simultaneously announced a successful joint technology trial with Skydio using its licensed Band n53 and XCOM RAN private 5G platform, validating its strategy for critical applications like autonomous drones. Analysts are divided, with Deutsche Bank initiating a "Hold" rating due to valuation concerns, despite the growing momentum in Globalstar's core licensed spectrum business.

title: Forget CarPlay, General Motors is Bringing Apple Music Capability to Some Chevys and Cadillacs
summary: General Motors is implementing native Apple Music integration into select 2025 and newer Chevrolet and Cadillac models, reducing the reliance on Apple CarPlay. This integration runs directly on GM's infotainment platform, offering features like Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos in Cadillac models, and will become a standard feature through OnStar Basics. While CarPlay will remain in gas-powered vehicles, native Apple Music will be available in many upcoming EV and gas models from Chevy and Cadillac, with Buick and GMC to follow.

title: DoubleDown Interactive prices secondary offering at $8 per ADS
summary: DoubleDown Interactive (NASDAQ:DDI) has announced the pricing of a secondary offering of 2,330,468 American Depositary Shares (ADSs) at $8.00 per ADS by STIC Special Situation Diamond Limited. The offering, representing a slight discount to the current market price, will not generate proceeds for DoubleDown. The company maintains a strong financial position, and the transaction is expected to close around December 18, 2025.

title: Morgan Stanley bumps Apple stock price target, but maintains Overweight rating
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its price target for Apple's stock to $315 from $305, while retaining an Overweight rating, citing a higher revenue forecast for fiscal year 2027 despite projected increases in memory costs. This new target reflects an anticipated 15.8% upside from Apple's current closing price, influenced by expectations of slightly higher iPhone shipments and the impact of incremental AI investments on operating expenses. The bank expects a 130 basis points drop in gross margin due to higher memory input costs, offset by a 5% higher revenue forecast driven by price hikes.

title: Artivion Inc stock hits all-time high at 48.06 USD By Investing.com
summary: Artivion Inc.'s stock (AORT) reached an all-time high of $48.06, driven by strong investor confidence and impressive financial performance, including a 58.86% one-year return and a recent beat on Q3 2025 earnings. Analysts maintain optimistic outlooks with raised price targets, reflecting confidence in the company's future prospects and upcoming product launches.

title: The Unassailable Fortress: Why TSMC Dominates the Semiconductor Landscape and What It Means for Investors
summary: TSMC is an undisputed leader in the global semiconductor industry, particularly for advanced AI and HPC chips, commanding approximately 70-72% of the pure-play foundry market. Its technological prowess with 3nm, 5nm, and impending 2nm nodes, alongside advanced packaging solutions like CoWoS, makes it indispensable to major tech giants. The company's financial performance is robust, but it faces geopolitical risks due to its concentration in Taiwan and increasing competition.

title: T-Mobile’s 2 new December changes in push to poach rival customers
summary: T-Mobile is introducing two new initiatives in December to attract customers from rival carriers: the "15 Minutes to Better Initiative" and a free iPhone 17 256GB offer. The "15 Minutes to Better Initiative" allows customers to switch efficiently through the T-Life app, while the free iPhone deal requires signing up for specific plans and involves bill credits over 24 months, along with an activation fee and taxes. These moves come amid backlash from customers over T-Mobile's new late fees introduced in November.

title: 3 Top-Ranked AI-Driven Computer Storage Devices Stocks to Buy for 2026
summary: This article identifies three top-ranked AI-driven computer storage device stocks – Western Digital (WDC), Teradata (TDC), and Seagate Technology (STX) – positioned for strong performance in 2026. The companies are expected to benefit from increasing demand for robust data storage solutions driven by cloud computing, IoT, AI, and generative AI. Each of these stocks currently holds a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), indicating their strong potential for investors.

title: Morgan Stanley raises Apple stock target to $315, citing incredible 2026
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its Apple (AAPL) stock price target from $305 to $315, maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This adjustment reflects anticipated opportunities for Apple's growth in 2026, driven by an estimated 5% higher revenue due to price hikes and a marginal increase in iPhone shipment forecasts, particularly benefiting from an extended 5-year replacement cycle for the iPhone 17. The firm also expects sustained double-digit revenue growth in Services and improved supply chain leverage.

title: Total Wireless Introduces Edge, a Comprehensive Device Financing Program For Prepaid Customers
summary: Total Wireless has launched Edge, a new device financing program for prepaid customers, in partnership with Glow Services Corp. This program aims to eliminate traditional prepaid obstacles by offering premium devices with $0 down and monthly payments as low as $0, with eligibility based on payment history rather than credit score. It's designed to reward customer loyalty, provide access to high-end technology, and expand device options for budget-conscious consumers.

title: Squarepoint Ops LLC Boosts Stock Position in Cirrus Logic, Inc. $CRUS
summary: Squarepoint Ops LLC significantly increased its stake in Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) by 1,042.9% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 34,103 shares valued at approximately $3.56 million. This boost aligns with other institutional investments and positive analyst ratings, as Cirrus Logic recently surpassed Q3 earnings expectations, leading to price-target raises and a "Moderate Buy" consensus. The semiconductor company's stock has seen substantial institutional ownership, with 87.96% of shares held by such entities.

title: Is Keysight Technologies Stock Outperforming the Dow?
summary: Keysight Technologies (KEYS) has shown strong performance, outperforming the Dow Jones Industrials Average over the past three months, year-to-date, and over 52 weeks. The company, a leading provider of electronic design and test solutions, reported a 10% year-over-year increase in Q4 2025 revenue and a significant rise in non-GAAP EPS, contributing to positive investor sentiment. Analysts rate KEYS a "Strong Buy" with a projected upside of 7.3%.

title: Cintas (CTAS) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Cintas (CTAS) is set to report its Q4 earnings on Thursday before the market opens, with analysts expecting revenue to grow 7.8% year over year to $2.76 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.20 per share. The company has a strong record of exceeding revenue estimates and enters earnings with positive investor sentiment in its segment. Cintas is the first among its peers to report, making its performance a key indicator for the business services & supplies sector.

title: Warren Buffett Sells Apple Stock and Buys a Trillion-Dollar AI Stock Up 12,180% Since Its IPO
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold a significant portion of its Apple stock and initiated a new, albeit small, position in Alphabet during the third quarter. While Apple is well-positioned to capitalize on AI, its current valuation is considered expensive. Alphabet, on the other hand, presents attractive opportunities across digital advertising, cloud computing, and autonomous driving, with a more reasonable valuation and impressive historical returns.

title: Adams Wealth Management Sells 2,335 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Adams Wealth Management reduced its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 17.6%, selling 2,335 shares to hold 10,960 shares valued at $2.249 million. Institutional ownership of Apple is high at 67.73%, with significant activity from firms like Vanguard, State Street, and Norges Bank, while insiders including CEO Tim Cook have been net sellers. Apple reported strong quarterly earnings, beating consensus estimates with an EPS of $1.85 and revenue of $102.47 billion, and maintains a market capitalization of $4.06 trillion with a PE ratio of 36.76.

title: Tesla’s Rally to Record High Is Leaving Big Tech Peers Behind
summary: Despite sales challenges and market share loss in China and Europe, Tesla's shares have rallied 25% since November 21st, hitting a record this year and outperforming the Bloomberg Magnificent Seven Index. Investors are optimistic due to CEO Elon Musk's focus on AI and autonomous driving, seeing Tesla as a potential AI powerhouse. However, the company faces hurdles like a potential sales halt in California and high valuations, with some analysts considering its multiples "crazy."

title: The Developed Markets Mandate: Analyzing the iShares MSCI World ETF’s 2025 Trajectory
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) saw a strong 20.5% return in 2025, driven by U.S. tech and AI, but its exclusion of emerging markets led to potential underperformance during a late-year emerging market rally. The fund is highly concentrated in U.S. mega-cap technology stocks, with the U.S. dominating its geographical allocation. Investors are now evaluating whether the AI-driven advantage of developed nations will maintain its dominance over the recent strength in emerging markets.

title: Alphabet Seizes Mag 7 Crown With 62% Stock Surge — But Amazon's Bargain Is The Plot Twist
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOG, NASDAQ: GOOGL) has significantly outpaced its fellow "Magnificent 7" stocks this year with a 62.26% surge, making it the top performer and solidifying its position among mega-cap companies. Conversely, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) has lagged dramatically with only a 1.05% year-to-date gain, but its consequently lower valuation metrics, like a price-to-sales ratio of 3.48, suggest it might be a bargain compared to its more expensive peers. This creates a contrasting narrative within Big Tech, where Alphabet wears the performance crown while Amazon quietly offers a potential deal.

title: Adobe hit with proposed class-action, accused of misusing authors’ work in AI training
summary: Adobe is facing a proposed class-action lawsuit alleging it used pirated books, including those by author Elizabeth Lyon, to train its SlimLM AI model. The lawsuit claims Adobe's SlimPajama dataset, derived from RedPajama, incorporated the "Books3" collection of 191,000 copyrighted works without consent or compensation. This case is part of a growing trend of lawsuits against AI companies for using copyrighted material in their training data, following similar actions against Apple, Salesforce, and Anthropic.

title: General Motors Is Doing The Unthinkable: A Paid Feature Is Now Becoming Free On Some Of Its Cars
summary: General Motors is now offering free internet connectivity for audio streaming in some new cars, integrating it into the OnStar Basics connectivity bundle. This move includes the native Apple Music app with Spatial Audio for Cadillac owners, making these features free for eight years after vehicle purchase for eligible 2025 and newer models. This changes GM's previous approach of charging customers for such connectivity services.

title: FactSet (FDS) Reports Q4: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
summary: FactSet (FDS) is set to report its Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a 5.5% year-on-year revenue growth to $600 million and adjusted earnings of $4.36 per share. The company beat revenue expectations last quarter but missed EPS estimates. Despite missing revenue estimates twice in the last two years, investor sentiment in the capital markets segment is positive, with FactSet's stock up 7.1% over the last month.

title: Why JELD-WEN (JELD) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of JELD-WEN (JELD) rose after an analyst at Jefferies increased the stock's price target from $2.25 to $2.60, indicating a more optimistic outlook on the company's valuation. This upward revision, even without a rating change, was seen as a positive signal by investors. Despite the positive news, the stock remains significantly down year-to-date and from its 52-week high, highlighting its volatility.

title: Globalstar (GSAT) Stock News on Dec. 16, 2025: Deutsche Bank Starts Coverage, Skydio Drone Trial, and Updated Analyst Forecasts
summary: Globalstar (NASDAQ: GSAT) stock fell 8.5% on December 16, 2025, despite positive operational news. Deutsche Bank initiated coverage with a "Hold" rating and a $62 price target, while Globalstar announced a successful drone trial on its Band n53 and XCOM RAN private 5G platform with Skydio. This highlights the ongoing tension between strong technological advancements and valuation concerns for GSAT.

title: Amkor Technology (AMKR) Stock Drops on Dec. 16, 2025: Latest News, Forecasts, and What Investors Are Watching
summary: Amkor Technology (AMKR) shares dropped sharply on December 16, 2025, amidst a broader "risk-off" tech market, despite strong underlying trends in advanced packaging driven by AI and U.S. manufacturing expansion. The stock's recent run-up and a cautious macro outlook contributed to profit-taking, even as Q3 2025 results showed record revenue momentum and a dividend increase. Investors are watching the upcoming CEO transition and the next earnings report, balancing the strategic importance of packaging against potential headwinds from a softer smartphone market and margin pressures.

title: What American Express CEO Just Said Should Get Dividend Investors Very Excited
summary: American Express CEO Stephen Squeri's recent statements highlight the company's strong credit quality and affluent customer base, leading to lower write-off rates during economic downturns. This positions American Express as a compelling dividend growth stock with a proven track record of increasing dividends at an 11% compound annual growth rate over the past decade, making it a favorite of Warren Buffett, who maintains a significant stake in the company.

title: Liberty All-Star® Growth Fund, Inc. November 2025 Monthly Update
summary: The Liberty All-Star Growth Fund, Inc. (NYSE: ASG) published its November 2025 monthly update, detailing its investment approach, top 20 holdings, monthly performance, and sector breakdown. The fund employs three growth investment managers focusing on small-, mid-, and large-cap companies. Key holdings include NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, and the report also notes new holdings and liquidated positions, alongside performance metrics for both NAV and market price.

title: Global Horizons: Vanguard's VT ETF Emerges as a Cornerstone for Long-Term Investors in 2026
summary: The article highlights the Vanguard Total World Stock ETF (VT) as a foundational investment for long-term investors looking towards 2026, emphasizing its broad global diversification, low expense ratio, and passive management approach. VT offers exposure to approximately 10,000 securities across developed and emerging markets, providing resilience and growth opportunities amidst a complex global economic landscape. This strategy allows investors to benefit from worldwide growth while mitigating localized risks, aligning with prevalent trends in cost-efficient and diversified investing.

title: Rezolve Ai expects to achieve positive adjusted EBITDA in December
summary: Rezolve Ai expects to achieve positive adjusted EBITDA in December, anticipating its strongest month ever with revenue exceeding $17 million and annual recurring revenue (ARR) surpassing $200 million for 2025. The company, which provides AI-powered customer engagement, has shown exceptional revenue growth and aims to reach $500 million in ARR by the end of 2026, despite expecting a GAAP net loss due to non-cash items. Recent strategic moves include processing over $1 billion in digital asset transactions and acquiring Crownpeak for $90 million.

title: WT Wealth Management Increases Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: WT Wealth Management increased its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 8.7% in the second quarter, owning 44,563 shares worth $9.14 million, making it their 9th largest holding. Despite this, company insiders, including CFO Kevan Parekh and CEO Tim Cook, have sold significant shares totaling over $58 million in the past 90 days. Analyst sentiment remains largely positive, with numerous "buy" ratings and an average price target of $282.51.

title: Tribridge Partners Financial LLC Makes New $1.54 Million Investment in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Tribridge Partners Financial LLC has made a new investment in Apple Inc., acquiring 7,525 shares worth approximately $1.54 million, constituting 0.9% of the firm's holdings. This comes as corporate insiders have been net sellers, offloading shares worth around $58.6 million in the past three months. Apple reported an earnings beat with a market cap near $4.05 trillion and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts.

title: Globalstar stock initiated at Hold by Deutsche Bank with $62 target
summary: Deutsche Bank initiated coverage on Globalstar (NASDAQ:GSAT) with a Hold rating and a $62.00 price target. This target is below the stock's current trading price of $69.05, and InvestingPro data suggests GSAT is overvalued and in overbought territory. The bank's analysis highlights Globalstar's strategic shift to being Apple's direct-to-device network operator and the material strategic value gained from its spectrum after the Echostar and SpaceX deal.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL is Texas Permanent School Fund Corp's 10th Largest Position
summary: Texas Permanent School Fund Corp significantly reduced its stake in Alphabet (GOOGL) by 31.9%, selling 215,764 shares, though it remains their 10th largest holding. Despite this, Alphabet reported strong earnings, beating analyst expectations, and analysts generally maintain positive ratings with an average price target of $314.22. Insiders, however, have been selling shares, while the company pays a quarterly dividend of $0.21.

title: General Motors confirms upcoming Apple Wallet car key support
summary: General Motors has confirmed its plans to support Apple Wallet digital car keys, following backend code discoveries and previous announcements from Apple. While specific timelines and supported models have not yet been provided, this integration will allow users to store digital car keys on their iPhones, enabling passive entry, proximity features, and remote locking/unlocking for their vehicles. This news comes shortly after GM announced a new Apple Music app integration in its infotainment systems.

title: This streaming stock is on fire this year. Morgan Stanley expects even more gains ahead
summary: Morgan Stanley has double upgraded Roku (ROKU) from underweight to overweight, significantly raising its price target to $135 from $85. Analyst Thomas Yeh anticipates sustained double-digit platform revenue growth for Roku, driven by deepening partnerships, increased streaming prices, and a strong advertising environment. This positive outlook led to a more than 4% jump in Roku's shares, which have already surged 47% this year.

title: Should You Invest in the iShares U.S. Technology ETF (IYW)?
summary: The iShares U.S. Technology ETF (IYW) is a passively managed fund providing broad exposure to the Technology - Broad sector, currently holding a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy). Launched in 2000, it has over $20.71 billion in assets, an expense ratio of 0.38%, and has delivered a 23.43% year-to-date return. The ETF is considered a medium-risk choice, diversifying company-specific risk with 147 holdings.

title: Orion Porfolio Solutions LLC Sells 2,236 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Orion Portfolio Solutions LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 0.2% during the second quarter, selling 2,236 shares and bringing its total holdings to 957,004 shares valued at $196.35 million. Despite insider selling by CEO Timothy D. Cook and other executives, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus with an average price target of $282.51. Apple's stock is currently trading around $274, with a market capitalization of $4.05 trillion.

title: GM secures deal to bring Apple Music to Chevrolet, Cadillac models
summary: General Motors has secured a deal to integrate Apple Music into a range of its Chevrolet and Cadillac models. This will initially include electric and gasoline-powered Chevrolet vehicles, with Buick and GMC models gaining access subsequently. The move aims to enhance in-car entertainment options for GM customers.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Stake Reduced by Fulcrum Equity Management
summary: Fulcrum Equity Management decreased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 33.1% in the second quarter, selling 2,165 shares and retaining 4,370 worth about $897,000. Additionally, Apple insiders have been net sellers, with CFO Kevan Parekh and SVP Deirdre O'Brien conducting significant share sales totaling over $12 million. Despite this, Apple reported strong Q2 earnings, exceeding expectations with $1.85 EPS on $102.47 billion in revenue, and maintains a market capitalization of $4.05 trillion.

title: Centaurus Financial Inc. Cuts Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Centaurus Financial Inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 4.3% in the second quarter, selling 2,808 shares and holding 62,773 shares valued at approximately $11.06 million. Despite this, Alphabet showed strong financial performance, beating earnings and revenue estimates, with the stock trading around $308 and a market capitalization of $3.72 trillion. Insiders have sold off a significant number of shares recently, though institutional investors and hedge funds still collectively own 40.03% of the stock.

title: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Stock Price Down 1.5% - Time to Sell?
summary: Apple's stock (NASDAQ:AAPL) dropped 1.5% to $274.11 during Monday's trading, with lower-than-average volume. Despite this dip, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus with an average target of $282.51. The company recently beat earnings expectations and announced a quarterly dividend, although insiders have sold a significant number of shares.

title: Assurant stock hits all-time high of 232.45 USD By Investing.com
summary: Assurant Inc. (AIZ) stock reached an all-time high of $232.45, reflecting strong investor confidence and the company's robust market performance. The company also reported impressive third-quarter 2025 results, with EPS and revenue surpassing expectations, leading to a new $700 million share repurchase program and a 10% dividend increase. Analyst firms like Keefe, Bruyette & Woods and BMO Capital have raised their price targets due to growth in the Housing and Lifestyle segments.

title: GM strikes deal to put Apple Music in all of its new vehicles
summary: General Motors has finalized a deal with Apple to integrate Apple Music into Chevrolet and Cadillac models via an over-the-air update. This move comes after GM started phasing out Apple CarPlay in 2023, a decision that drew criticism from consumers. The new integration will provide native access to Apple Music, including Spatial Audio on some Cadillac models, without needing CarPlay.

title: General Motors Attempts To Soften The Blow Of Removing Apple CarPlay
summary: General Motors is trying to appease customers upset about the removal of Apple CarPlay and Android Auto by integrating a native Apple Music app into select 2025 and newer Cadillac and Chevrolet models. This move, while seemingly beneficial, is seen by critics as GM's strategy to eventually funnel customers into subscription services after an initial eight-year complimentary period. GM aims to capitalize on new revenue streams by encouraging the use of its own app-focused interfaces and collecting customer data.

title: Jim Cramer makes the case for buying Procter & Gamble stock
summary: Jim Cramer advocates for investing in Procter & Gamble, highlighting its effective use of technology to cut costs and innovate. He distinguishes these "business-to-business users of technology" from "tech hyperscalers" who spend heavily on AI to compete. Cramer suggests P&G is a strong buy due to its efficient operations, current valuation, and dividend yield, contrasting it with increasingly competitive and costly big tech stocks.

title: Tesla board made $3 billion via stock awards that dwarfed tech peers
summary: Tesla's board of directors has collectively earned over $3 billion through stock awards, significantly exceeding the compensation of their peers at other major U.S. technology firms. This discrepancy, highlighted by an Equilar analysis, shows Tesla directors' awards were disproportionately large at the time they were paid, leading to massive windfalls as the company's stock price appreciated. Despite a suspension of new stock grants since 2020 due to a shareholder lawsuit, the existing awards have generated substantial wealth, sparking criticism over director independence and the structure of their compensation.

title: Teradyne CEO Smith sells $223k in company stock By Investing.com
summary: Teradyne CEO Gregory Stephen Smith recently sold 1,108 shares of company stock for $223,051, as part of a pre-arranged trading plan. This comes as Teradyne reports an 18% increase in Q3 revenue due to AI-related semiconductor testing demand, leading to several analyst upgrades and plans for a new robotics operations hub. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.12 per share.

title: 5 Of The Best Free Apple CarPlay Apps That Users Swear By
summary: This article highlights five top free Apple CarPlay apps that enhance the in-car experience, focusing on navigation, entertainment, and communication. It details Waze for navigation, Overcast and Libby for podcasts and audiobooks, Weatherology for real-time weather, and WhatsApp for messaging, all praised for their utility and high user ratings. The author emphasizes that while these apps are free to download, some offer premium features or are ad-supported, and provides insights into why each app is a valuable addition to CarPlay.
